  • Field Details

    • contactList

      public static ArrayList<Contact> contactList
      An ArrayList that contains every Contact object.

    • contactsExist

      public static boolean contactsExist

    • boxWidth

      public static int boxWidth
      Sets the width for the box the contacts are displayed in.

  • Constructor Details

    • Contact

      public Contact()
      Forces every new contact to have a personal ID, first name, last name and phone number. Address and e-mail are not set at this point.

    • Contact

      public Contact(String tempID, String tempFirstName, String tempLastName, String tempPhoneNum, String tempAddress, String tempEmail)
      Creates a contact and sets attribute values from pre-existing information. Used by loadContact() every time the program starts.

  • Method Details

    • setPersonalID

      public void setPersonalID()
      Takes input from console and checks if it matches the pattern of a personal ID. If input is invalid, it calls itself again to retry. If input is valid, it sets the input to the attribute.

    • getPersonalID

      public String getPersonalID()
      Returns the personal ID of the contact.
      Returns:
      the personal ID of the contact

    • setFirstName

      public void setFirstName()
      Takes input from console and checks if it matches the pattern of a name. If input is invalid, it calls itself again to retry. If input is valid, it sets the input to the attribute.

    • getFirstName

      public String getFirstName()
      Returns the first name of the contact.
      Returns:
      the first name of the contact

    • setLastName

      public void setLastName()
      Takes input from console and checks if it matches the pattern of a name. If input is invalid, it calls itself again to retry. If input is valid, it sets the input to the attribute.

    • getLastName

      public String getLastName()
      Returns the last name of the contact.
      Returns:
      the last name of the contact

    • setPhoneNum

      public void setPhoneNum()
      Takes input from console and checks if it matches the pattern of a phone number. If input is invalid, it calls itself again to retry. If input is valid, it sets the input to the attribute.

    • getPhoneNum

      public String getPhoneNum()
      Returns the phone number of the contact.
      Returns:
      the phone number of the contact

    • setAddress

      public void setAddress()
      Takes input from console and checks if it matches the pattern of an address. If input is invalid, it calls itself again to retry. If input is valid, it sets the input to the attribute.

    • getAddress

      public String getAddress()
      Returns the address of the contact.
      Returns:
      the address of the contact

    • setEmail

      public void setEmail()
      Takes input from console and checks if it matches the pattern of an e-mail address. If input is invalid, it calls itself again to retry. If input is valid, it sets the input to the attribute.

    • getEmail

      public String getEmail()
      Returns the email address of the contact.
      Returns:
      the email address of the contact

    • info

      public String info()
      Adds all the attributes of a contact in a box format into a single string.
      Returns:
      a string that contains all the information of a contact

    • formatInfo

      public String formatInfo(String text)
      Formats text to fit into a box with a set width.
      Parameters:
      text - a string that gets formatted to fit into the box
      Returns:
      the string "text" with added spaces and a border for the box

    • data

      public String data()
      Adds all the attributes of a contact into a single string.
      Returns:
      a string that contains all the information of a contact

    • write

      public static void write(Contact contact)
      Writes text to a file using BufferedWriter and FileWriter. Writes the raw data to one file and the list that is displayed to the user to another file.
      Parameters:
      contact - the contact which has its attributes written to the file

    • reWriteList

      public static void reWriteList()
      Writes the contents of contactList to a file file using BufferedWriter and FileWriter overwriting previous contents of the file.

    • read

      public static void read()
      Reads text from a file using BufferedReader and FileReader, then prints it to the console one line at a time.

    • find

      public static int find()
      Iterates through the contactList (an ArrayList) to find the specific index where the contacts personal ID attribute is equal to the input. If the method does not find a match, it asks the user to either retry, view contacts to check every contacts ID or exit to menu.
      Returns:
      the index of the matching contact if match is found

    • loadFile

      public static void loadFile()
      Reads the data file that contains every contact and adds them to a single string per contact that is then split into attributes and created into a contact by the toContact method. This method is called first every time the program starts.

    • toContact

      public static Contact toContact(String allLines)
      Splits a string into parts and assigns them as attributes to a contact.
      Parameters:
      allLines - a string that contains data about a contact
      Returns:
      a new contact that has all its attributes set.
